intro: Chassalia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, typically growing in open, sunny habitats. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chassalia rostrata is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its environment.
